That's why I'm force to play Raiden semi hypercarry aggravate with Nahida, the invesment is already too great for her to be an E bot. My bad perhaps I didn't make it clear.

3.author: Theotheos
3.body:
Oh yes I agree on that C2 is waste of resources if you want to play hyperbloom like you said. But still, I think aggravate is better especially on more invesment levels and on more constellations for both Raiden and Nahida.

Hyperbloom is very f2p and low invesment friendly but the dmg ceiling is reached relatively easily and the more invesment you put the worse hyperbloom dmg becomes in comparison with other sources of dmg.

Tho you can techially play aggravate and hyperbloom on the same team with something like Xingiu and Yelan, your hyperblooms wont deal as much dmg but the C2 Raiden will deal much more overall dmg than just beeing an E bot, with hyperblooms beeing an extra source of dmg, especially since nahida gives 250 Em to Raiden + 72 em if you have Nahidaa's R1 weapon and also C2 Nahida will buff both hyperbloom and aggravate dmg.

5.author: kazuyaminegishi
5.body:
I can see why you'd see it that way but Albedo's story quest paints the difference as being whether or not Traveler is being impacted by the rules of Teyvat.

> Albedo: But the integral preliminary conclusion that I can offer you is... You're very much like a human from this world.￼ ...
￼ That's it?

> Paimon: You couldn't tell that just by looking?

> Paimon: We spent all day working our butts off for that!?

> Albedo: Please, I understand that this may have seemed self-evident to you, but in fact nothing in this world should be taken for granted.

> Albedo: Have you ever considered that the world of Teyvat may have a natural hostility to outlanders?
￼ Only the gods would know.
￼ Perhaps.

> Albedo: I mentioned the natural laws of this world. You're able to converse with me here without consequence, and nothing seems amiss. But it's arguably a small miracle.

I'd say they very much intend us to interpret the traveler as relatively normal biologically, but is having a peculiar interaction with Teyvat. It's likely a part of the lore of Khanreiah considering Dainsleif is also immortal.

5.author: LJP95
5.body:
Dainsleif's situation is completely different.

He and all other Khaenri'ahns (with the exception of Kaeya's family, who were in Mondstadt at the time) were cursed by the Gods with immortality: the members of the Abyss Order and many Hilichurls suffer from the same curse. However, they're still subject to the erosion of their minds and souls. For Hilichurls, this is the reason they degenerate into primitive beasts, and eventually dissolve into the Abyss based on what we observe in the Chasm. 

Dainsleif is still suffering erosion of his mind, and has lost a large portion of his memories. But he has access to some specific, unnamed thing that has allowed him to retain his sense of self. It's unknown whether this has a relation to the Abyss Order, or whether Pierro is in the same boat. 

The Traveler, meanwhile, is immortal in a way that no one on Teyvat can attain. Unlike even Dragons and Gods on Teyvat, the Traveler doesn't erode. This is the reason that Zhongli wants them to witness the history of Teyvat: so that by carrying these memories across the stars, there will always be a record of their world.

5.author: kazuyaminegishi
5.body:
We only know so far that traveler's memories aren't impacted by the rules of Teyvat shown by not experiencing erosion as well as them not losing memories when Irminsol is changed.

But, we haven't been told yet that their immortality comes from not being from Teyvat. We know that traveler slept for a long time upon first arriving in Teyvat and we know the sibling was at Khaenriah. 

My memory is a bit hazy on the first Dain story quest but I recall Traveler being shocked at the implication their sibling has been alive for over 500 years.

All we know is that the people present at Khaenriah became immortal, we don't know how or why as far as in-game lore.

5.author: LJP95
5.body:
Their immortality doesn't have to do with Teyvat: rather, they were immortal before they ever arrived. The Wings of Descension note that the twins witnessed the births and deaths of stars as they traveled the cosmos, and both of these things can take hundreds of thousands to millions of years to occur. Zhongli is also sure that the Traveler will outlive this world and bring their memory of it with them as they travel to other worlds. 

And we know for a fact that the people of Khaenri'ah were cursed with immortality by the Gods. Dainsleif's entire Chasm questline deals with this, and the fact that many of the Hilichurls as well as members of the Abyss Order are what remain of his people.

10.author: Tatatatatakiwaru
10.body: Zajef is a clown using EM Razor. I wouldn't take his advice seriously. He was incredibly wrong about Kazuha on release, and he clearly favors Xiao over Wanderer. I have and use both C6R5. Even when C0R1, Wanderer was considerably better. Actual TCs from CN (like Koinzell) already broke down the numbers, and Xiao is objectively weaker (although not by a considerable margin).

10.author: EJGP24
10.body:
As I said, numbers on paper might look very cool, but from my personal experience, Wanderer gets knocked out like team rocket by any hilichurl arrow (and that A4 mitigates a little, but dodging is still a dps loss, ofc getting knocked is a higher dps loss but you get the point), pushes enemies away from his attacks, and his teams are a mess that makes him a jack of all trades, but master of none. I'll check koinzell out.

Maybe with the perfect stats, perfect rotation, all attacks hitting everyone, perfect execution of the attack string with 0ms of delay he might get faster clear times than Xiao, but all that ain't happening to anyone.

10.author: Tatatatatakiwaru
10.body: Another misconception. Dodging is not a DPS loss, unless you're using up stamina to do so. If you use his dodge with A4 procced and use it to animation cancel, it's not a loss. Very tired of people regurgitating the false info Zajef peddles to people. As to pushing enemies away, Xiao does this much worse. It doesn't require anymore effort than it does on Xiao. Wanderer is better.

12.author: Penguinswithpants
12.body:
to quote wikipedia:

>The game is free-to-play and is monetized through gacha gamemechanics through which players can obtain new characters and weapons.The base game is expanded regularly through patches using the games as a service model.  
>  
>The gacha game model began to be widely used in the early 2010s, particularly in Japan.\[1\]\[2\] Most of the highest-grossing mobile games in Japan use it, and it has become an integral part of Japanese mobile game culture.\[3\] The game mechanism is also increasingly used in Chinese and Korean games, as well as Western games.\[3\]\[4\]\[5\]\[6\] Despite their ubiquity, gachagames have been criticized for being addictive, and are often comparedto gambling due to the incentive to spend real-world money onchance-based rewards.

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gacha\_game](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gacha_game)

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genshin\_Impact](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genshin_Impact)

20.author: AsterJ
20.body: That's for a specific order. If you want 8 unique dice in any order there are 8! permutations.  That's the factor you are off by.

20.author: n0tApirate
20.body: Ahhh fair enough. I haven't touched permutations for a few years so I completely forgot that the order is unnecessary in this situation. Thank you for replying.

20.author: AsterJ
20.body: I usually think about it as rolling the dice one at a time.  For the first roll any of the 8 colors is fine so you get an 8/8 term.  The next one can't repeat the first color but the other 7 is fine so you get a 7/8 term.   Likewise the next term will be 6/8 and so on until the last term where you must get the one color left and is 1/8.   Multiplying all those 8 fractions  together and you have 8⁸ in the bottom and 8! on top.

20.author: n0tApirate
20.body: Ah that makes perfect sense. Thank you for showing me how to properly do this.

29.author: die-ursprache
29.body:
I am pretty surprised to hear that the Wanderer didn't do it in time - if anything, he's one of the best counters to this dumb boss. Last time I tried a hypercarry team here, Pisslord was at 20% hp before he even used the shield.

If your hypercarry team doesn't have Zhongli, consider bringing Yun Jin (hold E oneshots the heads) or Ningguang, that fight doesn't require that much dodging.

If your hyperbloom team has Nahida, you can also strip it to its bare core (Raiden Nahida + hydro applicator) and put Ningguang on Prototype Amber into the last slot. This ensures that you can still deal damage to the boss while he's flying and take the shield down quickly. If no Nahida but you are using Xingqiu for hydro application, I suppose they would also deal enough damage to force the boss into the shield phase fast.

If it is of any help, [here's an example of hyperbloom + Ning that I ran a few days ago.](https://youtu.be/1RpoItg0Jh4?t=247)

29.author: winter2001-
29.body: Ttds Ningguang... You just lit a lightbulb in my brain

29.author: winter2001-
29.body: My Wanderer hypercarry team is a little rough tbf, it's Wanderer-Bennett-Yelan-Zhongli, no Faruzan no C4 Jean. I'd try Yunjin, but I don't have her, and Zhongli breaks the heads too slow imo, so I think I'll try Ningguang in the same team you used in that clip, since I do have all the components for it. Thanks for the tips!

29.author: die-ursprache
29.body:
Zhongli isn't *that* slow. :D I believe the fastest approach is tap E near the first head (so that the stele stays on field and deals damage to it) -> burst on the second head to oneshot -> first head is dead by that point as well, so you just run to the third one and either cast tap E twice on it, or tap E next to it and start setting up your bursts in the middle of the arena while Zhongli's stele finishes the job.

Anyway, good luck. I look forward to the good news!

33.author: ElivaOil
33.body:
I'm not sure if you have Bennett, he would definitely be very useful in a lot of the options. Here are some good abyss teams, that come to mind:

Raiden Hyperbloom: Raiden + Yelan + Xingqiu + Yaoyao

This would be a team, where you would build full Elemental Mastery on Raiden - which means you wouldn't go for the big damage on her Burst and instead rely on her triggering Bloom seeds with her skill for big reaction damage. It might seem like an odd way to use her on the surface, but it's one of the strongest low investment teams in the current meta.

Rational: Raiden + Yelan/Xingqiu + Xiangling + Bennett/Xingqiu

National: Xiangling + Bennett + Yelan/Xingqiu + Sucrose/Xingqiu

These two teams wouldn't really use Xiangling as a support and rather as the main damage dealer from off-field.

A very good team that utilizes Xiangling for her Pyro application would be Reverse Melt (Xiangling + Bennett + Rosaria + Kaeya), so look to try that one if you haven't yet.

33.author: KLoliV
33.body: About Bennet I do have him but to be fully honest I never understood his attacks, ill make sure to use him more to learn about him. 😁 Thanks for all the team recommendations I just need some luck so I can get yelan next banner.

33.author: ElivaOil
33.body:
He is one of the strongest units in the game, so definitely worth looking into - his synergy with Xiangling is also insane.

\- he has very good Healing, even if you don't build him on HP  
\- his Elemental Skill has a very low cooldown, which makes it so he can generate a lot of Pyro Energy for himself and other party members, making him a great combo with Xiangling, who tends to struggle to get enough Energy to use her Burst  
\- **and most notably:** he gives a **massive** Attack buff with his Burst, and because a lot of off-field damage dealers [snapshot](https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Snapshotting), that basically makes it so he gives it to almost if not the entire party

Because of that he tends to be a great character for any team that appreciates attack buffs, while simultaneously filling out the healer slot too.

33.author: KLoliV
33.body: Wow thanks for all the info I'll look into building him 😀

34.author: WaterImpact
34.body:
OK you're just being condescending and pedantic at this point dude. It's unnecessary. 

I never claimed I expected Amber to be a god tier character, but I literally addressed the idea you're talking about in the comment you're replying to. If you'd like we can substitute the word "underwhelming" for "less effective than" or "less powerful than." In relation to each other we can definitely say who does more damage on average between Lisa and Raiden Shogun, there is an objective difference between them there. Thus if someone wants more damage they may find Lisa "underwhelming" compared to Raiden Shogun. 

If you don't buy my logic than so be it. I feel like I've explained it pretty well.

34.author: WaterImpact

I fear I've given you far more benefit of the doubt that you deserve considering how bitter and rude you're being now. You *are* being pedantic when it is very easy to see "underwhelming" in the context of OP's post as essentially meaning "failing to impress, due to being less effective or powerful than other characters *or* than expected." Which, as I said earlier, can be seen as objective *or* subjective depending on what we're talking about. I'm not redefining the word. 

Reply if you want, I'm not replying to you further though. I believe I have had to *over*explain things for you at this point.

Including the one in the Chasm's first Archon quest? Where Dansleif describes the Abyss teleportation system and Paimon states that it's similar to Waypoints.

Also Mona's scene shows exactly what I'm talking about. The only thing related to water in that scene lies on the water globe that is formed around them. After the globe is fully formed they become a Pilar of light and teleport while moving upwards, the initial point remains on the ground which implies that it works with coordinations, probably using the stars, it also implies that there is an end port to it, otherwise the stating point wouldn't remain.

More importantly, it explicitly shows that it's not based on spacial manipulation. A Wormhole would've been very appearent since it would look like a portal showing the end location through it. 

Now if you could not work with whay you were given, that's on you, but don't you came at me calling me a troll and saying that there is no info when you can easily infer a lot from what we were actually given.

37.author: datbloodysorc
37.body:
Leylines is a concept that still exists in reality idiot.
It is present in many cultures, including Chinese culture where it receives the name of dragon veins or something like that.
It's one of the basis of Feng Shui. You can learn more of that on your own time

Lastly, just because "Teyvat has it's own laws" does not mean that they haven't used concepts from real life in Teyvat. There's literally nothing stopping that. 
Last I checked it's "Teyvat has it's own laws", doesn't mean Teyvat is completely alien to reality

37.author: IlliasTallin
37.body: Leylines are not real, just because an idea exists as a part of a culture does not make it a reality.

37.author: datbloodysorc
37.body:
Wait, what? You do understand what leylines are supposed to be right? It's theorized as a form of energy that runs through lines, that are like the planet's veins. The Chinese has their own version in the dragon veins. Which unlike the leylines, exist in anything. 
And by the way neither has been disproven, much on the contrary, science has yet to find evidence on either side of the debate. Much like religion, where one cannot disprove the existence of divine entities.

They also believe that mountains and rivers are places where such veins can be found in abundance. 
Anyway the existence of this concept is part of what gave rise to Feng Shui.

And unlike Ley lines, Feng Shui has found uses in specific sciences, despite being considered a pseudoscience.
For example it is actively used by some archeologists to find the location of ruins and other historical locations, it is used in botanical research and also in the study of asian architecture. 
It's important to remember that Science has never discredited the existence of Earth's pulse as a concept. The only thing that happened is that no connection between the scientific method and these concepts have been found.

Pay close attention to this distinction because there are forces and energies that science still cannot observe, despite having seen evidence of their existence, which is the case of Dark matter and Dark energy. Which scientists are pretty sure they exist, but no machine or animal can detect it's presence. 
Scientists only know about it because nothing else can justify some of the astronomical phenomenons that have been observed through all of the collected astronomical data collected from other star systems and galaxies

40.author: Due-Distribution-463
40.body:
Was it really though because I see no Skyrim in Genshin.

Genshin is more like a Tales game or MMO.

It lacks the living and interactable world that characterizes Skyrim. Especially since Skyrim is not combat focused, it just has combat in it. Whereas Genshin is very combat heavy.

In Skyrim you find things in the world that send you on an adventure. In Genshin you kill respawns in an empty game world.

40.author: grumpykruppy
40.body:
Day one player. I used to see it talked about all the time, but not in the past year or so at all.

I'm bringing it up because I saw yet another argument on quests, with takes ranging from "I love it" to "Hoyo should just remove world quests and NPCS, and make everything solely focused on the playable characters." It's clear Genshin has a wide-ranging audience, so I just thought I'd say my piece and hopefully get the varying sides to understand each other better.

40.author: grumpykruppy
40.body:
I'd say the side quests are a lot closer to Bethesda quests than the event quests or the MSQ, which is typically where the "stay put for two hours" thing happens. And bluntly speaking, Bethesda quest dialogue is barely animated *at all* beyond the character talking and whatever might happen to be going on around them - it doesn't have any camera angles besides what the player has (which is the same for side quests in genshin usually, although Genshin is third person while Bethesda games are first person normally).

And remember, World Quests (and maybe some dailies) are basically what I'm talking about here - the design of those is ENTIRELY different from the main quest and event quest design.

40.author: grumpykruppy
40.body:
The *quest design once a quest is started* and how the lore is presented are similar. I'll concede that Skyrim definitely has a lot more quests you just kind of run across and then you find yourself in Blackreach or serving a Daedric Prince or killing the servant of a Daedric Prince, (Genshin has a few quests that just start from finding something, but they're comparatively rare), but the quests that absolutely scream "this is a quest" operate similarly, like the Golden Slumber and Sacred Sakura Cleansing quests (I can actually draw pretty direct comparisons to the CoW main quest in terms of how it sends you through increasingly large dungeons and the Saadia quest for length and "sidequest-ness", if not for the choice option, in Skyrim).

The big crucial difference I see is the lack of choice in Genshin, which Skyrim side quests often have - Genshin's never do.

Since Klee had also a thing that is more complex? Idk when it was but i think Klee called it her treasure (atleast in my language).

49.author: Dora_Queen
49.body: If you weren't saying I said that then why mention Hu Tao not ruining the business when my point was that Tao didn't have a choice to run it or not? Also the fact that you think that if a festival goes wrong, you just need to get a replacement is quite wrong. Like if Ayaka ruined the festival on accident, it would be a big talk between the locals and the Yashiro commission could get a lot of shit for it. Klee needs to remake a bomb from scratch, yes but there's not a big harm in accidentally getting it wrong, especially if Alice has shown her how to do it safely.

49.author: _QueenShiroi_
49.body:
I wanted to say with HuTao not ruining the business, that even teenagers/young people can do such things with Independence. I didnt mean the whole Festival would need a replacement. I meant when like the guy who makes food there, needs to say no (like three days before the Festival), since he doesnt have time. There would be many people in Inazuma, Ayaka can ask if they can take that Position over.

Also Ayaka can host a Festival at 16. In my school, every last-year classes (we dont have the us/uk system, so i cant really describe the school type) need to host their own prom. The last-year class of the third year school and five year-school (which are around 40 people, if we have full classes, but this year we are only around 30) need to host it.
Two people from each class, are like the chefs. They plan the decoration, how the tables look, etc. And there is only one teacher, who is only allowed to give us tips (like how they did it last year)

While the rest of the class helps then building everything/decorating before the prom.
Also we need to sell tickets for other people. Because not only we go to it but also people from the city (and others) are allowed to go and have fun with us. 
The third years are around 16-17. While the five years are around 18-19.
Like, when we can do it. Why doesnt Ayaka can? 

Also you see like the girl scouts selling their Cookies. Or some random child, sitting in their yard or something and selling lemonade or their old toys. "But these are only small things". Yes, but still they learn how to be sucessful/Independent at a young age. If you can sell Things at a age around 8-12 (or younger, i saw like 6 year olds selling their toys), then why cant Ayaka host a Festival at 16 (if shes the age)? Specially if she got teached to be Independent. Also in my country, you need to be atleast Independent in some things with 15. Because at 16, you get so many Options and Things where you dont need the allowance of your parents. You can do it on your own.

49.author: Dora_Queen
49.body:
I'm sorry but what? Again, Tao was forced to take over the business. She had no choice and she NEEDED to be careful with how she was running it. Also of course she didn't screw it up, I'm pretty sure Wangsheng Funeral Parlour is the only funeral parlour in Liyue Harbour atleast. Regardless of how crappy a company is, if they're the only company of a certain thing within a 10 mile radius, then you're 100% going to go to them. And also a class of 30-40 kids all working together is nothing compared to hosting a festival, neither is doing small things. I don't know how lowly you think of hosting a festival but like, if someone cancels 3 days before a festival then it won't be super easy to just replace them, like you need to make reservations and everything and if others in the city are busy then you'll need to look overseas or outside of the city (during the sakoku decree, you'd have to look outside of the city). That can be hard to do. If anything, and I mean anything, goes wrong you bring dishonor and shame upon your family, commission and yourself. You're making a festival ran by one person, with possibly a bit of help here and there, sound so simple as real life 18-19 year olds can do it but then say she's 16. She's never been said to be 16, and she's meant to be interpreted as a young adult, atleast 18. 16 is far too young to be hosting festivals and to be one of the faces for an entire commission and family.

Also, why are you comparing hosting a festival to selling toys or something, that's what you do at a festival, not when planning one?

50.author: Wastable
50.body: Man your brain is smoother than a freshly mopped floor

50.author: Wastable
50.body: Can't be powercrept if she was never good in the first place ¯\\\_(ツ)\_/¯

50.author: Wastable
50.body: So? Any character build properly can clear abyss.

50.author: Wastable
50.body: Being able to clear doesnt mean is as strong as Raiden. You are comparing apples and oranges. Jesus how smooth is your brain? Did you use an angle grinder on it?
